title: O C N W T R
description: In 2010 I rode my bicycle over 16,000 kilometers thru 10 countries from Canada to Colombia. As I traveled I learned that people didn’t have clean drinking water in certain parts of the world. In 2015 I adopted the village of El Palmar in El Salvador. Over the next 7 years from 2015-2022 I took over 200 people on 17 different trips to discover how to best solve this problem In 2019 I founded O C N W T R - a local church that began with 3 people in a Jui Jitsui studio on Wednesday Nights in San Clemente CA in May 2019. Since that time we helped start 35 other churches in 6 countries that disciple about 1100 people and have produced 7287 liters of water I have traveled to 42 countries and hold a B.A. in Religious Studies, an M.A. in Counseling & a Doctorate in Public Health Policy. I work as a Special Education teacher in the public school system in California. I am a volunteer at O C N W T R and teach this podcast as a way to give back what I have learned. Love and Blessings. Dr. Ryan Delamater. www.ocnwtr.com

title: Tehetséggondozás
description:
1. Évad - 20 huszonéves tehetség 2020-ban.
Ki mondta azt, hogy 20 évesen nem lehetsz példakép?
A Magyar Ifjúsági Központ YZ Intézete, a Paprika Rádió és a K plusz program felhívást tett közzé olyan aktív, húszas éveikben járó fiatalok bemutatására, akik tehetségükkel és tevékenységükkel kimagasló eredményeket értek el. Célunk 20 olyan fiatal bemutatása, aki az üzleti élet, kultúra, tudomány, sport vagy közélet kategóriában egyedülálló és Kolozsvárhoz köthető teljesítményt mutatnak fel.

2. Évad - Mi a pálya?
Nem tudod eldönteni, hogy mi leszel, ha nagy leszel? Munkahelyet váltanál, de nem is tudod, hogy merre? A LinkedIn, a CV sablon és egyéb eszközök ismerősek... mi azonban tanáccsal segítünk! 
A Paprika Rádió, a Kplusz és a Magyar Ifjúsági Központ Egyesület mindenféle, munkához kötődő tanáccsal vértez fel. A Mi a pálya? című műsorunkban segítünk. Szakemberek és munkakeresők, az ideális kombináció.

title: NON DOLET PODCAST
description:
NON DOLET nasce dalla volontà di un gruppo di Veterani delle Forze Speciali Italiane, supportati da membri della comunità militare e dalle Forze dell'Ordine, di creare un'Associazione che rappresenti la comunità di Patrioti che hanno fatto del DOVERE e dell'ONORE la propria ragione di vita. NON DOLET (cit. "non fa male") rappresenta il mindset che caratterizza ogni Veterano, basato sul senso di rinuncia alla propria persona in favore degli altri ignorando dolore e difficoltà. Lo scopo dell'Associazione è informare, condividere e valorizzare le battaglie passate, i caduti e tutti coloro che abbiano indossato una divisa. 
Questo Podcast è il primo del suo genere in Italia, i membri dell'Associazione intervistano Veterani che hanno vissuto esperienze traumatiche e hanno deciso di raccontarsi, facendo emergere storie di fratellanza, leadership, coraggio e crescita personale.

description:

Wir haben uns daher das Ziel gesetzt den Studierenden die diversen Berufsfelder näher zu bringen, die das Studium eröffnet. Dazu führen wir mit verschiedenen Persönlichkeiten mit kunsthistorischem Hintergrund Gespräche, die wir in Form einer Podcast-Reihe vorstellen. title: Arch Street Meeting House: Untold Stories in Quaker History
description:
Quakers have and continually help shape the definition of freedom by actively standing at the forefront of major reform movements in American history, including abolition, African-American history, women's rights, prison reform, making education and healthcare available to all, and temperance.

Join Denis Long each month as he interviews educators and historians on how Quakers have made long-lasting impacts on history. Each episode explores the untold stories of Quakers, shedding new light on the Quaker history narrative.
author_name: Arch Street Meeting House Preservation Trust

title: Besjede o obrazovanju

Besjede o obrazovanju su razgovori sa zaljubljenicima u obrazovanje. Domaćini u studiju, Nedim Krajišnik i Namir Ibrahimović do sada su ugostili profesionalce iz oblasti obrazovanja, nastavnie, učenike, pedagoge…

Besjede nemaju granice.

Centar za obrazovne inicijative Step by Step je profesionalna, nevladina organizacija osnovana sa ciljem da promoviše obrazovnu filozofiju usmjerenu na dijete, i pravo svakog djeteta na kvalitetan odgoj i obrazovanje na području cijele Bosne i Hercegovine

title: The Hidden Addiction Podcast
description: Hello and welcome to the Hidden Addiction Podcast. This podcast is brought to you by the New York Council on Problem Gambling. Across New York state we have 7 resource centers dedicated to connecting individuals to care. We are here to increase awareness about problem gambling and advocate for support services for persons adversely affected by problem gambling. Problem Gambling is defined as risking something of value on a game of chance. There can be many types of gambling, and it can affect anyone at any time in their life. It may not be talked about often and kept in the dark, but we hope this podcast sheds light on the hidden addiction of gambling and brings forth resources and information for you to use.
author_name: New York Council on Problem Gambling

We will hold our governments accountable, and provide you with the tools to do the same.

title: Hear, HERE! - The humanitarian podcast.
description:
Founded in Geneva in 2014, the Humanitarian Exchange and Research Centre (HERE) has the specific mission to contribute to closing the gap between policy and humanitarian practice. We endeavour to understand and promote the steps that need to be taken in order to ensure that humanitarians do the right thing with regard to crisis-affected people.
In this podcast, we shed light on specific topics related to the gap between policy and humanitarian research, and engage in dialogue with humanitarian actors and others to understand their views on, and to point to possible solutions. As such, this podcast is part of our ambition to stimulate mutual learning and critical thinking among humanitarians.

title: AIAA Los Angeles - Las Vegas Section Podcast
description:
AIAA is non-profit 501(c)3 professional organization promoting aerospace. Our purpose is to ignite and celebrate aerospace ingenuity and collaboration, and its importance to our way of life. Our promise is to be your vital lifelong link to the aerospace community and a champion for its achievements.

One Remarkable Fact Says It All: Since 1963, members from a single professional society have achieved virtually every milestone in modern American flight. That society is the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics. With nearly 30,000 individual members from 91 countries, and 95 corporate members, AIAA is the world’s largest technical society dedicated to the global aerospace profession. Created in 1963 by the merger of the two great aerospace societies of the day, the American Rocket Society (founded in 1930 as the American Interplanetary Society), and the Institute of the Aerospace Sciences (established in 1933 as the Institute of the Aeronautical Sciences), AIAA carries forth a proud tradition of more than 80 years of aerospace leadership.

The Los Angeles – Las Vegas Section is a community of 7000+ Aerospace Professionals, providing services to the communities from Los Angeles to Las Vegas, including San Bernardino and Riverside. Southern California and Las Vegas area has lots of aerospace organizations add activities, and is the center of American aerospace.

title: THEBOARDCHECKUP: A RESEARCH-BASED PODCAST
description:
THEBOARDCHECKUP explores the subject of board performance with leaders of nonprofit organizations around the world interested in nonprofit governance as well as those who used the online tool known as Board Checkup to self-assess board performance. 

In Season 1, each episode is a case study profiling a different board and organization as well as trends in the external environment driving change in governance.  Board motivation for assessing performance is discussed along with change in the board and its impact on the organization. Each episode concludes with a summary of lessons learned and the elements that make each case a great love story.

In Season 2, the nine dimensions of board effectiveness assessed in the Board Checkup are explored with nonprofit leaders.  Each dimension assessed is defined theoretically. Next, drawing from the research, common issues that can challenge board effectiveness are discussed along with theories about why they exist, and change boards have implemented in response to them.   

The podcast will be of interest to board chairs, CEOS, and directors looking for accessible and affordable research-based tools and resources to measure, track, and develop in leadership and governance effectiveness. It will also be of interest to consultants working with boards as well as regulators and funders concerned about board accountability and impact. Finally, it will be of interest to faculty and students of nonprofit leadership looking for case studies that explore the complex nature of governance, the governance context in different cultures and countries, and the range of leadership roles and responsibilities boards and directors play in the organizations they govern.

title: Podcast del Centro de Estudios de Justicia de las Américas
description:
El Centro de Estudios de Justicia de las Américas (CEJA) es un organismo internacional del Sistema Interamericano, con autonomía técnica y operativa, que tiene como misión apoyar los procesos de reforma y modernización de los sistemas de justicia en las Américas. 

CEJA provee asistencia técnica a los gobiernos, poderes judiciales y otros actores de los sistemas de justicia regionales, desarrolla estudios, imparte programas de capacitación especializados para juezas y jueces, fiscalas/es, defensoras/es, abogadas/os litigantes y diseñadoras/es de políticas públicas.  

CEJA fue creado el 15 de noviembre de 1999 por resolución de la Asamblea General de la OEA. Las Cancillerías de los Estados Miembros dieron cumplimiento de ese modo al Plan de Acción de la Segunda Cumbre de las Américas (1998) y a las recomendaciones de la Reunión de Ministros de Justicia u otros Ministros, Procuradores o Fiscales Generales de las Américas (REMJA).

description:
Onderaan de Streep is de podcast van de Vastelastenbond die je helpt om slimmer met je vaste lasten om te gaan. Host Frank van de Ven bespreekt in deze podcast de laatste ontwikkelingen op het gebied van energie, verzekeringen, verduurzaming en de WOZ waarde. Profiteer van handige tips om geld te besparen. Of je nu wilt weten hoe je je energierekening omlaag kunt brengen, hoe je de beste deal kunt vinden voor je autoverzekering, of hoe je je huis duurzamer kunt maken: je vindt het allemaal in deze podcast.

In Onderaan de Streep worden waardevolle inzichten gedeeld door de product specialisten van De Vastelastenbond. Deze specialisten hebben jarenlange ervaring op het gebied van energie, verzekeringen, verduurzaming, hypotheken en de WOZ waarde.

Door regelmatig te luisteren naar Onderaan de Streep, blijf je op de hoogte van de laatste ontwikkelingen en kun je slimmer omgaan met je vaste lasten.

Of je nu net begint met het managen van je financiën, of al jarenlang een ervaren bespaarder bent: deze podcast biedt voor iedereen waardevolle informatie en tips om meer uit je geld te halen. Met regelmatige updates en een schat aan kennis en expertise, is Onderaan de Streep de perfecte podcast voor iedereen die zijn vaste lasten serieus neemt. Abonneer je vandaag nog en ontdek hoe je kunt besparen op je vaste lasten!

title: 旧青年街垒
description:
旧青年街垒是由三个来自苏南县城但不幸流落世界各地的旧青年创立的podcast，这三人分别是在瑞典斯德哥尔摩艰苦奋斗的Officer Li, 位于北美湾区的非典型程序员一横以及在苏南县城坚守阵地的民间艺术家烤肉。

        做Podcast的念头最早来源于学校社团。2017年，同为摇滚青年的Officer Li和一横于社团公众号上开启了一档以夹带私货的乐评闻名的新栏目，名为反声（Anti-Voice）。反声之名取自哈利波特中的的巫师小报《唱唱反调》（The Quibbler）以及美国朋克乐队反旗（Anti-Flag），然而在用完社团储备人才库（6人以及场外嘉宾烤肉）后，反声就此终结，而Officer Li在反声某期中承诺的电台也被搁置。幸运的是，期间Officer Li通过一横结识了烤肉，经过长达数年的酝酿及拖延，终于决定于2021年12月13日重启podcast计划。

        为什么是旧青年街垒？

        旧青年对应创刊于1915年的《新青年》杂志，《新青年》杂志在创刊时提出的对青年的六点要求如下：

        自由的而非奴隶的

        进步的而非保守的

        进取的而非退隐的

        世界的而非锁国的

        实利的而非虚文的

        科学的而非想像的

        曾经的新青年在时间意义上已经成为了旧青年，在这样一个日趋保守和诡谲的时代里，我们三人作为顽固的守“旧”份子，仍然将这些百年前“旧”青年提出的要求作为我们的奋斗目标，并将不遗余力地对社会发挥副作用。

        街垒来自于歌曲《到街垒去》，其也反应了我们三人的基本立场：反对一切形式的压迫。我们希望在某种程度上进行有意义的讨论，并以podcast为载体在我们的听众和外部世界的喧嚣中筑起一道街垒，借此重建与我们一样的“旧”青年之间的连接。

title: Just Economics
description:
In the Just Economics podcast, economist Ioana Marinescu (www.marinescu.eu), associate professor of public policy at the University of Pennsylvania School of Social Policy and Practice and research associate at the National Bureau of Economic Research explores what we actually know about how policies and labor markets work, including the science behind job creation and unemployment insurance.

 Each episode introduces the work of an eminent scholar whose research provides evidence that empowers us to create a more just world. In some episodes, Ioana will be joined by her colleague, Katherina ‘Kat’ Rosqueta, founding executive director of Penn’s Center for High Impact Philanthropy and adjunct faculty at Penn’s School of Social Policy & Practice. Together, Ioana and Kat will discuss the implications of the guest scholar’s research, with Ioana focusing on the policy implications, and Kat focusing on the implications for philanthropy – i.e., private action for public good.

title: Feitmans & PeePee. Over gokken enzo
description:
Peter-Paul de Goeij (NOGA / Quod Bonum) en Feite Hofman (AGOG / PoGG) zijn een podcast begonnen: ‘Feitmans & PeePee. Over gokken en zo.’

Gezien hun nogal verschillende achtergrond en werkzaamheden zou je deze podcast op voorhand al opmerkelijk mogen noemen. Iemand uit de gokbranche én iemand met wie het ooit niet erg goed ging qua gokken te samen in één podcast!

In deze eerste podcast haken zij aan bij het laatste Tweede Kamer debat over de vele reclames voor gokken, vertellen zij over de meerwaarde van ‘in gesprek blijven’, gesprekken tussen de gok-branche, de zorg en ervaringsdeskundigen. Ook ontvangen zij hun eerste gast om deze de nodige vragen te stellen, gok-gerelateerd. Ze maken hier hun contactgegevens wereldkundig, waar eventuele nieuwe gasten uit de wereld van ‘gokken’ (of daarbuiten) zich vrijwillig aan kunnen melden. 'De Gast Van De Cast' blijft in elk geval een vast onderdeel van deze podcast, evenals ‘Het Nieuws Van De Afgelopen Weken.’

"Feitmans en PeePee is luchtig en serieus, scherp en zacht, en ernstig grappig tegelijkertijd." (een luisteraar van het eerste uur)

Benieuwd naar podcast één? Volg de link en beluister aflevering één.

Wil je gast zijn in podcast twee? Of liever over een tijdje, in nummer drie? Of heb je mogelijke onderwerpen die Feitmans & PeePee echt moeten bespreken?

Mail dan naar: reageren@feitmansenpeepee.nl

Wat kost gokken jou? Stop op tijd. 18+

Disclaimer: 

De in deze podcast door de makers geuite stellingen, meningen en/of overtuigingen zijn geheel op persoonlijke titel. De makers hebben daarnaast geen actieve herinnering aan welke stelling, mening en/of overtuiging dan ook en wijzen iedere aansprakelijkheid met kracht van de hand.
author_name: Feite Hofman en Peter-Paul de Goeij

title: The Teens for Peace Podcast
description: Using several years of research by youth-led organization Teens for Peace in the Middle East, this miniseries seeks to uncover the opinions, ideas, and experiences of teenagers caught in the middle of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict and use the words of teenagers to craft suggestions for the future of youth peacebuilding in the Middle East. Each episode highlights one question asked by host, 17-year-old Max Hyman from Chicago, to each of over 30 teens from Israel and/or Palestine in interviews and dissects many of the responses and what they reveal over the successes and failures of the peacebuilding system. Episodes end with conclusions from these discoveries and focus on the importance of listening to teen voices. Teens for Peace in the Middle East, founded in 2020, was built by a team of teens looking to make a difference by creating a network of connected teens for a more peaceful future in Israel and Palestine that values the voices of youth, who are young enough to reverse permanent and harmful stereotypes and opinions. In addition to over 30 interviews, teenspeace.org features educational materials for teens to learn about the conflict from an unbiased perspective, and Teens for Peace in the Middle East hosts panels and discussions. The organization is currently planning a PeaceSummit event and is conducting professional research on the successes and failures of the peacebuilding system.

title: #DefendDemocracy Podcast Series
description:
Autocrats thrive when the free world is divided. We’ve seen what happens when the United States retreats from the world, and the world’s democracies start to put narrow interests ahead of values. Democracy around the world begins to decay. 
Our podcast series aims to provide front-line figures in the battle for freedom and democracy a global platform. 

The Alliance of Democracies Foundation is a non-profit organization founded in 2017 by Anders Fogh Rasmussen, the former NATO Secretary General and former Prime Minister of Denmark. The vision of the Alliance of Democracies Foundation is to become the world’s leading “megaphone” for the cause of democracy. We do this through three programs: The Copenhagen Democracy Summit, The Expeditionary Economics Program and The Campaign for Democracy.

title: F.E.S. Podcast
description:
Fondacija Friedrich Ebert u Zagrebu i Sarajevu – u saradnji sa regionalnim uredom za Jugoistočnu Europu – kreirali su F.E.S. Podcast. Ovaj jedinstveni podcast zapravo se sastoji od tri tematska virtualna prostora za razgovor – odnosno podcaste „Riječ na F...“ (Sarajevo), „Riječ na E...“ (Zagreb) i „Riječ na S...“ (#loading). Različite playliste ovog podcasta posvećene su trima izrazito važnim društvenim temama – feminizmu, ekologiji i okolišu, te socijalnim temama. 

„Riječ na F...“ donosi nam razgovore o umjetnosti, politici, religiji, aktivizmu, i svakodnevnom životu iz perspektive feminizma i sa ciljem promoviranja rodne ravnopravnosti, sa govornicima/cama iz cijele Bosne i Hercegovine. 

„Riječ na E...“ epizode poslušajte ukoliko i sami želite uvrstiti nove, održivije prakse u svoj svakodnevni život, ali i čuti nešto novo o temama održivosti, zaštite i poboljšanja okoliša, jer „ne postoji plan(eta) B“. 

Kroz ova dva podcasta vode vas Ines Baždalić (Sarajevo) i Nina Skočak (Zagreb), a nove epizode dostupne su svakog mjeseca.

The main goal of GreenTeens is to inspire our listeners to get out and make a change for our Earth from hearing others' stories, so they too can become green teens! I'm your host, Colleen McDermott. I am 16 years old and a part of the Miss America's Teen Program. The MAO is not only the leading scholarship provider for young women. They also give young women the platform to advocate for a cause they are passionate about called their Community Service Initiative. My Community Service Initiative is Planet Youth, advocating for the environment to our youth through education, service, and awareness. I hope to be able to share a little inspiration to every young listener to get out and get green through this podcast. I hope you enjoy and thank you for tuning in!

title: Goggles On! with JEI
description:
Goggles On! with JEI is from the Journal of Emerging Investigators with host Scott Soldat-Valenzuela, Executive Director. We dive into science and STEM conversations with young scientists, experienced professionals and, frankly, anyone who contributes to the development of scientists in the United States. 

The Journal of Emerging Investigators is an open-access journal that publishes original research in the biological and physical sciences that is written by middle and high school students.  JEI provides students, under the guidance of a teacher or advisor, the opportunity to submit and gain feedback on original research and to publish their findings in a peer-reviewed scientific journal. Because grade-school students often lack access to formal research institutions, we expect that the work submitted by students may come from classroom-based projects, science fair projects, or other forms of mentor-supervised research.

Three great friends from a Crossfit gym in rural Dorset are trying to break the stigma around mental health by talking about the ups and downs of life. The idea of this podcast came off of the back of Adam and Adam's idea to set up a not-for-profit clothing brand, The Brave and Determined Company (BaD Co). title: Proefdiervrij de Podcast: we zijn verder dan je denkt
description:
Het gebruik van proefdieren in de wetenschap is niet nieuw. Maar in een tijdperk van zelfrijdende auto’s en commerciële ruimtereizen, vragen wij ons toch af… hoe lang moeten dieren het nog ontgelden in de naam van de wetenschap?

Proefdiervrij de Podcast is dé podcast over proefdieren en vooral over hoe we die zo mogelijk de wereld uitkrijgen. Collega’s Saskia en Romy dagen elke maand een andere proefdiervrije pionier uit om ons te laten zien dat Nederland zonder die vreselijke dierproeven kan. Wat is er nodig voor een proefdiervrije wereld? En moeten we het niet eens gaan hebben over een dierproevenverbod? Dit (en nog veel meer) bespreken we elke laatste vrijdag van de maand om 16.00 uur in Proefdiervrij de Podcast.

title: Sustainability and Impact Global Series
description:
From climate change, to poverty or gender inequality, enterprises and businesses are now asked to walk the talk- but what can be done? What is being done? 

This first season has eight exciting episodes exploring how some enterprises in Africa are working towards impact and sustainability. We will look into the tools they use, the challenges they face, how they adapt their pricing, marketing, distribution to commercially reach a growing market of more than 2,5 billion people -  with a positive impact!

The research and deliver were done by the talented Nova SBE Grad students of Prof. Filipe Alfaiate in his course “Leading Impact Enterprises in International Development”, as their final assignment. They did outstanding work. And the best six podcasts from the past 2 years are at the center of this Series and its debates with Prof. Filipe Alfaiate and TA Dr. Daniela Afonso.
author_name: Filipe Alfaiate @ Nova Business and Economics School

title: Putting a Face (and Voice) with Disability
description:
The Halle Grace Foundations presents a new series in which I interview individuals diagnosed with disabilities, in the podcast, "Putting a Face with Disability."  Through these podcasts, we allow individuals to use their voice and share their story of how their diagnosis has impacted their life.  These amazing humans open their hearts to us as they share the psychological, social, emotional, and vocational impact disability has had on their lives. They have chosen to use their voice to change others' perception of disability, in turn, creating a more inclusive world.  We hope you enjoy hearing their stories.  

These podcasts were developed as part of the University of South Florida's new, online graduate course, Medical & Psychosocial Aspects of Disability as part of their new, fully, online master's program, Rehabilitation Counseling and Disability Sciences (RCDS).

title: Remnant Church
description: PURPOSE // To gather those called by their Father to know HIM in order to make HIM known // Malachi 4:5-6 Remnant Church of Denton exists for the purpose of raising up sons and daughters of Christ's Kingdom for this generation and the next. Sons and daughters as expressed in 1 Corinthians 4:15 and 1 John 2 speaks in a familial language. Once we begin to study the bible, we can understand the familial perspective from which it was written. In search of authentic relationships that mirror our studies we reach out to our local church. For many of us, this is where the journey ends as we discover institutionalized church that leaves us wanting. The leadership of Remnant Church desires to witness your potential and help you make it reality. Jesus said that the harvest is plentiful but the workers are few. We are not interested in gathering numbers or sustaining you on milk. Instead, we look forward to meeting those who God has ordained to make up our Remnant family; to live and learn mutual devotion together and look forward to the day that the student surpasses the teachers. MISSION // To grow, equip, and mature every saint for the work of THE ministry // Ephesians 4:11-13 "Each generation will praise your works to the next and proclaim your mighty acts." Psalms 145:4 CJB Scriptures such as Psalms 145:4, Deuteronomy 4:9-10, Psalm 78:6, and John15, presume that the believer is living according to the Genesis 1:28 mandate which is: to be fruitful, multiply, fill and subdue the earth. This does not exclude those who cannot or have not had physical children. We passionately believe in growing up in the Faith, from sons and daughters to mothers and fathers, that we may indeed make an impact on our current generation. Even more so that we might leave a strong impression on the next. Acts tells us that although God's promises may be first realized by us in our generation, that by design, it is given to us to impact the next. Teaching us not to live as consumers but rather, to lift up and pour into the next generation. Remnant Church’s greatest hope above all, is that the goodness of God that has been so abundantly poured out on our lives would be evident to all. We desire that our lives would be lived with such a passion and affection for Jesus, that what has been freely given to us would be imparted to those around us, whereby, fulfilling the Genesis 1:28 mandate to multiply His presence in this present generation. VISION // To give fully mature sons and daughters to all nations until the full harvest has come in, the bride has made herself ready, and King Jesus is enthroned in Jerusalem // Micah 4:6-8 Discipleship is a lifestyle not a program. We have found it best to simply: - live a life abandoned to Jesus - allow the Holy Spirit to gather those who desire to do the same - enter into everyday life together as we live and learn how to better re-present King Jesus to a hopeless and dying world. VALUES // To guard Holy Spirit empowerment, Lifestyle Evangelism & Missions, Historical Christian Orthodoxy, and Eternal Family // Matthew 28:16-20 ​

title: Failing to Save the Earth
description:
What if one of the most effective ways to save our battered and feverish planet lies in our failure to be able to do so? 

“Failing to Save the Earth,” is a revolutionary dual-tool for frontline and fence line organizers who wish to achieve greater effectiveness by facing potential failures head-on. Forget the old concept of movement “wins'' or “losses,” this podcast and guide-booklet (coming soon!) are an invitation to rethink our relationship with the definition of failure when working to create social change. Learn from the L’eau Est La Vie resistance camp leadership and their epic, yet “unsuccessful,” campaign to stop the Bayou Bridge pipeline. Determine powerful leverage points within your struggle. Listen to veteran frontline water and land protectors, get inspired, and then prepare to follow the additional step-by-step printed guide-booklet (due to be released in Fall 2022). Learn how to design your own plan for artful and effective failing, and also find out the one way that you will most certainly fail when working to stop social and environmental injustices.

A must listen for anyone committed to saving the Earth!

Cherri Foytlin is an executive director for Movement Training Network, and founder of L'eau Est La Vie Resistance Camp and Ndn Bayou Food Forest in Deep South Louisiana. Join our mailing list! https://global.us15.list-manage.com/subscribe?u=96ab610195ad24c962dd79be2&id=2dd3311286&fbclid=IwAR0iz5EC9xtsOpqHEaIT5pNz3pizg8yC62SfyqUWVne1jINK2hcKqjFayAU

title: Waste Not...And Feed The Need

Welcome to the Loaves & Fishes Family Kitchen podcast, Waste Note...And Feed the Need, where we have great conversations on topics such as Food Waste, Food Insecurity, Food Recovery, the Hidden Hungry, and our Unhoused Neighbors. Please follow us as we embark on this journey together.

Our Co-hosts are:

David Hott: With an educational background in Collaborative Health and Human Services from the University of California Monterey Bay, David brings extensive work experience in food recovery and corporate leadership. David serves as the Director of Operations at Loaves and Fishes in Silicon Valley, the home of the A La Carte Program. He holds a Board Position on the Northern California Recycling Association (NCRA) and is certified as a Practitioner in Zero Waste Principles and Practices from SWANA. A San Francisco Bay area native, David spends his free time as a wilderness guide in the backcountry of Yosemite.

title: Inadmissible
description:
Immigration. It’s in the news, it’s in the headlines, it’s a political flashpoint. It generates a lot of sound and fury, a lot of strong ideas and raised voices. And for most of us, it can be hard to sort through all that noise and understand – what is actually going on? What’s legal for people to do, and what’s not? How do U.S. immigration rules affect people’s lives? What is it like to deal with the barriers – both seen and unseen – to people who want to stay in the U.S.?

On this podcast, we explore the world of U.S. immigration – from issues that come up in the news like the border, and separation of families, to things you may have heard less about, like the strange and secret world of the immigration courts – to uncover how all of it works, Along the way we talk with lots of people with stories to tell about how immigration has impacted their lives. 

Hosts Lindsay Goldford Gray and Jennie Guilfoyle work together at a nonprofit called VECINA, that empowers immigrant justice advocates through mentoring attorneys, educating communities, and mobilizing volunteers.

title: Rivers in the Desert
description:
Rivers in the Desert is a collection of Holy Spirit inspired messages. You are listening to Senior Evangelist Ps Martin Duffy, Senior Pastor Ross Roberts, and occasionally from our guest preachers. Ps Martin Duffy is the Senior Evangelist and Founder of Elim Church Global who has an apostolic call to the nations. Elim Church Global was founded in 2006 on the Central Coast, NSW, Australia as a base to support global outreach. We are a non-denominational church community where all are warmly welcomed and where the whole counsel of God is preached in the Power of the Holy Spirit. We are a Church which believes that the Word of God is infallible and is to be obeyed. We believe all the gifts and power of the Holy Spirit is for today. We are a Church that is deeply missional; seeking to go into all of the world with the good message of salvation through Jesus Christ. We desire that all who attend meetings encounter God Himself and leave changed by this encounter. We also deeply desire that people are able to flourish in their gifts within a loving and supportive environment. The prophet Isaiah inspired by the Holy Spirit spoke: Behold, I will do a new thing, Now it shall spring forth; Shall you not know it? I will even make a road in the wilderness And rivers in the desert. The beast of the field will honor Me, The jackals and the ostriches, Because I give waters in the wilderness And rivers in the desert, To give drink to My people, My chosen. This people I have formed for Myself; They shall declare My praise.” ‭‭Isaiah‬ ‭43‬:‭19-21‬ ‭NKJV‬‬ We hope and pray Rivers In The Desert will truly enrich and strengthen your spirit-man. May the Lord Jesus meet you where you are, at this very moment. Be blessed!

Connect with us at info@elim.com.au.

If you'd like Ps Martin Duffy and team to minister the word of God at your local, please contact info@elim.com.au.

title: The Collective Tap: Conversations About Water
description:
THE COLLECTIVE TAP is a podcast about water and the many ways we interact with this critical resource every day. Some of those uses are obvious: washing dishes, swimming, or watering plants. Others are less obvious: generating energy, building roads, and manufacturing goods that travel far from the water’s source to reach their destination. But even given those many uses—and the many more users who expect clean water on demand—it’s easy to take for granted how critical this one resource is to life.

What, exactly, is the value of water? We try to answer this question through a series of engaging conversations with experts in their fields, and, hopefully, inspire a new appreciation of the waters you call home.

THE COLLECTIVE TAP is a project of the White River Alliance, a 501(c)(3)organization located in Indianapolis, Indiana. We are an alliance of diverse interests and organizations that work together to steward the River and its watershed. It is made possible with generous funding from the Nina Mason Pulliam Charitable Trust.

Produced in partnership with Absorb., a boutique music and media label.

title: 5 vor 12 - Ein Aufruf zur Veränderung
description:
Größen aus den Bereichen Tier- und Umweltschutz sprechen mit PANDA Tierversicherung über ihre Inspiration, ihren täglichen Kampf um Erfolge und den heutigen Stand unserer Welt. Das Ergebnis - es schlägt 5 vor 12.  
Greenpeace, One Earth - One Ocean, Hunderunde und Probiene: Gründer und Geschäftsführer lassen im Gespräch mit PANDA hinter die Kulissen blicken.
Wir wollten alles wissen - von den persönlichsten Erlebnissen, die dazu bewogen, das Leben dem Aktivismus zu widmen, bis zu konkreten Zukunftshoffnungen. Welche Rolle "Seekuh," Armreifen und die "dunkle Biene" dabei spielen und wer beim Klimaschutz wirklich die Zügel in der Hand hat, erfahren Sie im neuen PANDA Podcast.
Teilnehmer:
Günther Bonin - Gründer, One Earth - One Ocean
Alexander Egit - Geschäftsführer, Greenpeace Zentral- und Osteuropa
Tobias Miltenberger - Gründer, Probiene
Fabio Lehnert - Co-Founder, Hunderunde   

Bei uns im 10-Tages-Takt! Hören Sie rein und lassen Sie sich mitreißen - es ist nicht zu spät, um einen Unterschied zu machen.

description: Listen To Director, Pastor Tim Lane, And Various Guests, Talk About The Happenings At The Mission. Prepare Your Heart For Laughter And Tears As They Share The Unpolished Stories Of The Homeless And Hurting, Hope, And Transformation.

title: Color for Empowerment
description: Our mission is to educate children about relevant, ongoing issues such as human trafficking and ocean pollution through coloring and activity books with fun elements included such as mazes, word puzzles, and more. Our podcasts aim to educate and go in depth of issues with an older generation who might already have background of these. We hope you enjoy!

description: The EMAcast is an EMA podcast about current New Zealand business issues.

title: PIVOT Towards Promising Futures
description:
PIVOT Towards Promising Futures is a podcast for everyone invested in ending and preventing gender-based violence and deepening experiences of healing for children and their families.

In each episode, leaders working to end violence against children and families share their insights on what is needed to pivot our efforts towards a bright and promising future. We invite you to join wide-ranging discussions examining our collective work over the decades and taking an honest look at where we fell short, particularly for families of color. We'll explore what pivots can lead us to a future where we can help parents and caregivers get the resources and support they really need, and build more pathways toward healing and growth for ALL children and families who have experienced violence. Hosted by Wendy Mota and Surabhi Kukke, this podcast is presented by Promising Futures at Futures Without Violence.

title: Empowerment with Elizabeth
description: Hi y’all! My name is Elizabeth Swindell! Throughout my undergrad years and In high school, I had the opportunity to be around many influential women. Through this podcast, I hope to enlighten younger girls and women to let them know what is possible and what they are capable of and provide them with examples of women who are SLAYing the game in a variety of fields! My goal is to cover a different topic, career, or organization each week by inviting different women on who have influenced me positively and who I think others can benefit from listening to! Stay tuned and I’ll see y’all soon!

title: Unite DFW
description: Join us to hear about how Unite DFW's design for community outreach, and our vision of how everyone can play a part in the flourishing of the people around us.

title: Delco Skatepark Coalition Podcast
description:
Hosted by Erin Lopes, this podcast talks about all things skateboarding, skateparks, and ADA accessible, adaptive, all wheels and inclusive skating in Delco and beyond.

To learn more and support the Delco Skatepark Coalition, go to www.skatedelco.org.

Instagram: @delcoskatepod

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/DelcoSkateparkCoalition/

title: Beyond Beauty with PBA
description: Introducing PBA's podcast! Made so you can listen and be inspired during your busy day as we go Beyond Beauty. Take a deep dive into the beauty industry, get advice on how to navigate your career, and learn what motivates the best in the biz! New episodes every other Tuesday.

description: Ministrações gravadas nos cultos da igreja Videira Seattle.

description:
“T’ho contem” podcast adscrito en la Biblioteca de Palma de Gandia como programa para la difusión de la lectura, la actualidad y la cultura local. 
"T'ho contem" podcast adscrit a la Biblioteca de Palma de Gandia com a programa per a la difusió de la lectura, l'actualidad y la cultura local.

title: Science Humanitarian Podcast
description: There are many potent and relevant issues in our society today; it is important to raise awareness about these issues. Science Humanitarian could not just watch as these issues went unaddressed, so we created a podcast as they are effective ways to achieve this goal due to their convenience and increasing popularity.

title: The Institute Leaders Lifeline
description: The purpose of The Institute Leaders Lifeline Podcast is to give a simple, consumable piece of content that provides encouragement and important information to our School Leaders to start their week.

title: Criswell College Chapel
description: Welcome to the Criswell College Chapel podcast. Through each semester, the entire campus gathers for worship through song and a biblical, challenging, and encouraging message. Speakers include pastors, professors, and local business and non-profit leaders. At Criswell, we believe spiritual life is vital for everyone, and that is why Criswell’s goal in chapel services is to emphasize loving the Lord with all our heart, all our mind, and all our strength. We make leaders who are Ambassadors, Cultivators, Peacemakers, Problem Solvers, and Professionals. While chapel services are tailored to students, we’re encouraged by all our guest speakers by knowing that the practicality of what is being spoken is for everyone. To learn more about Criswell College, visit Criswell.edu Thank you for joining us.

title: Fin à la faim - Nutrition sans Frontières à l'écoute
description: Marie-France Lalancette, fondatrice de Nutrition sans Frontières, rassemble des professionnels, volontaires et citoyens engagés des quatre coins du monde qui apportent un éclairage et partagent leur vision afin de sensibiliser aux enjeux de nutrition mondiale et promouvoir l'innovation dans la coopération. Ensemble, on met FIN à la FAIM!

title: Beauty In Brown
description: South Asian appreciation multi-focus podcast!

title: A Wild Life featuring Michael the Wild Life Detective
description: Introduction to Michael the Wild Life Detective and his non profit Research Wild hosted by Jim Fisher.

title: DeFoodRestation podcast
description: Is there a link between the food we eat and deforestation? What role do consumers play? The lungs of the Earth are under threat. There are many stories to be told and voices to be heard. In this podcast, the Young Fair Trade Advocates provide you with the most important information you need to know.

title: CT Bible Study
description: Fall '22 Bible Study recorded live at Camp Thurman. Held weekly, this semester covers anything and everything related to the book of Revelation. Led by Nate "Jethro" Hohulin and attended by Camp Thurman staff, we have a discussion about what Revelation has to teach us about growing in our love for and faithfulness to Jesus.

title: Small, Important Victories: Living Actively with ALS
description:
A podcast from The Joe Martin ALS Foundation, where we equip people living with ALS (amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, or Lou Gehrig's Disease) to live actively amidst this challenging diagnosis. The Joe Martin ALS Foundation's mission is to empower families as they face the challenge of living actively with ALS by providing home care and other services at no cost.

We believe that with the help of family and a caring community people with ALS can live with purpose, with joy, and with hope. This philosophy drives us to empower families with the knowledge and tools to navigate this progressive disease.

Learn more and support our mission by visiting www.joemartinalsfoundation.org
author_name: The Joe Martin ALS Foundation & Neil Cottrell

title: Get to Know a Blue Gator
description:
Get to know Ascension Episcopal School staff, faculty, and students! The Director of Communications, Rachel Delcambre, speaks with a variety of school members to share their unique stories and perspective as a Blue Gator. 

Ascension Episcopal School is located in Lafayette, Louisiana and was founded in 1959.  With a mission of educational excellence in a Christian environment, the school prides itself on educating the whole child and offering many opportunities to experience learning. To learn more, visit www.ascensionbluegators.org

title: Back to Work Colorado
description:
Emily Griffith Technical College (EGTC) is a career-training institute with more than 20 certificate programs in downtown Denver and a dozen Registered Apprenticeship programs throughout the State of Colorado. As Colorado recovers from the economic hardships of the pandemic, Emily Griffith offers short-term workforce programs in high-demand, high-wage industries. 


With support from Emily Griffith Foundation, EGTC received a three-year, $850,000 Back to Work grant from the Colorado Opportunity Scholarship Initiative last Fall. In this six-episode podcast series, you will hear from workforce development experts, industry professionals, and students about how this incredible grant opportunity through the Colorado Department of Higher Education is getting Coloradoans back to work, and helping the state reach its credential attainment goal while recovering from the pandemic.

title: The Play Talk Podcast
description: Welcome to the play talk podcast – Max and Sarah talk about play for children and young people, and sometimes adults too.

title: Library Marketing for Library Marketers
description: The informal library marketing podcast for library staff who do all things marketing, communications, public relations, outreach, and more. Join your host, Katie, as she chats with various experts, library staff, marketing professionals, and other library marketers who share tips, tricks, tools, insight, and more.

title: BAM BIZ TALK
description:
You will hear insightful conversations encircling the entrepreneur's journey from 10-year University professor and successful multi-business owner, Executive Partner of BAM Consulting and President of BAM BizHub, Michael Crain, and multi-business owner, Executive Partner of BAM Consulting and Vice President of BAM BizHub, Angel Garcia. 
Every episode contains valuable information relevant to developing a successful business. From creating a viable and robust business model to market positioning and strategy, BAM BizTalk engages the listener and interacts with callers to answer their questions regarding their business or business idea.

title: La Hora de Calor
description: Una serie limitada publicada por WeCount! y su radio comunitaria, Radio Poder 97.7 FM, La Chispa del Pueblo!

title: Spot Radio ITJ
description: Spots  para Radio ITJ 2022

title: OLD'S COOL
description: Nezisková organizace Elpida už 20 let mění pohled na stáří. Ke svým 20. narozeninám si nadělila podcast OLD'S COOL. Moderátorka Adéla Paulík Lichková v něm otevírá témata, která vypadají, že se týkají výhradně stáří, ale ve skutečnosti hranice věku a generací už dávno překročila. Jedinečný je také tím, že si Adéla bude k mikrofonu zvát nejen odborníky, ale i samotné seniory.

title: Justice Watchers
description: This podcast will take you through an audio journey of the resilience of human rights defenders. It unpacks powerful stories that have remained untold. You shall listen to them for the very first time. The intention is to motivate you to join the human rights movement and be among those who stand tall against human rights violations. You will learn that these people are just as ordinary as you but will not keep quiet in the face of violations and abuses.

title: Lutheran Church of Hope West Des Moines- Ignition Messages
description: Ignition is the High School Ministry at Lutheran Church of Hope! Here you will hear messages from Ignition at the West Des Moines campus. Ignition meets Wednesdays from 7:30-9:30. Come and See!

title: Abundant Life with Nikkisha Lawrence
description:
Abundant Life podcast exists to inspire, capture, and enlighten hearts with practical tips on how to live the abundant life as stories of transformation and healing are shared. 

God is still in the business of taking a mess and turning it into a powerful message of hope and redemption for our good and His glory. 

May we surrender our lives to Him and experience the abundant life that He died for us to have.

“The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy. I came that they may have life and have it abundantly” (John 10:10).

title: Hope Dealers
description: From the world of Hope is Alive Ministries, join us each week as we meet with those who have a story to tell. Whether you are a resident of the HIA Program, a family member of one of our residents, a current or future supporter of HIA, or most importantly if you are the parent of someone struggling with addiction, our hope is that these stories will bring you strength and hope in your journey.

title: Sharing the Couch
description:
Sharing the Couch is an NT Shelter initiative, featuring interviews with thought leaders in the affordable housing and homelessness sectors. New episodes are published every second Thursday.

NT Shelter is the peak body for affordable housing and homelessness in the Northern Territory, Australia.

title: Pathway Church Podcast
description: Sermon Messages from Pathway Church in Longview, Texas.

title: Futuri Sostenibili
description: Futuri Sostenibili è un podcast incentrato sulla transizione ecologica e sul business sostenibile. Una serie di chiacchierate per indagare i molteplici aspetti che si nascondono dietro al concetto di sostenibilità.

title: Healing Souls Together
description:
This is a safe place to find biblically-based guidance, healing, compassion, and community for those caught in the wake of their spouse's adultery or sexual addiction. At this time, we only have programs for women, but are keenly aware that there are men who are abused by their wives. We hope to have a program for them soon as well.
Thank you joining me today!

title: Holzer Talk
description: Hello and Welcome to Holzer Talk Podcast! Join us as we speak to other Holzer Health System employees about their job, what it's like to work in healthcare, and so much more. We explore leadership topics and challenges and share ways to overcome those challenges. Learn how our employees live our mission of "Friendly Visits, Excellent Care; Every Patient, Every Time"

title: Teaching Race Matters
description:
In this series, the Runnymede Trust, the UK’s leading race equality think tank, explores why it is important to teach race, migration and empire in schools, and how we can empower educators to do so.

Teaching Race Matters is presented and produced by Alba Kapoor and Nannette Youssef, and edited by Alex Adetiba.

This series is funded by the Black & Veatch Foundation, a fund of the Greater Kansas City Community Foundation.

More on the Runnymede Trust: runnymedetrust.org

title: Kitchen Table: Leadership Conversations
description:
Lieutenant Berlin Maza & Deputy Fire Chief Bill Mack sit down with leaders in all professions and industries from across the country to have leadership conversations at the firehouse kitchen table!

Leaders share their stories, philosophies and perspectives on leadership. They talk about their non-negotiable behaviors, actions and traits, as well as offer action items for newer employees, emerging leaders, and senior members of organizations to grow as leaders!

title: PastorMarkCast
description: Pastor Mark is a Christian Pastor, author, blogger, and sometimes background actor. He brings all of his years of life experience to ask spiritual questions about the ordinary events of life.

title: Health in the 34th
description: Kansas is one of only 10 states in the U.S. who hasn't expanded its Medicaid program yet. Join hosts from the Alliance for a Healthy Kansas to discuss the latest topics in Health in Kansas, the 34th state, including KanCare expansion, the rise of medical debt, preserving rural health care, and other ways we can get access to affordable health care to our friends, family and neighbors in the Sunflower State.

title: Chamber Chat
description:
The High River Chamber Chat is where we talk all things business, leadership and High River events.
You'll meet your local business owners and staff to get a better connection to who they are and what drives them to open their doors every day.

We also bring important news from your local, provincial and national Chambers of Commerce as a support system for you, our business owners.

Get ready for insightful conversations and some laughs along the way.

title: SUPA SAPS - Single Use Plastic Awareness, Stop All Plastic Straws
description:
These podcasts are the result of international volunteering project "Single Use Plastic Awareness, Stop All Plastic Straws".
It aims to empower young people to become active agents of social change in their local communities, increase the capacity for self-management, independence and proactivity. And also to favor and give value to civic and solidarity activities, promote initiative, creativity and solidarity between young people from different countries.

title: Hey Bro
description:
"Hey Bro" is a podcast by MATES for mates. Join James and James as they will be tackling some tough – but important - topics and opening up their space for safe kōrero around mental health, wellbeing, and suicide in the New Zealand construction industry. 

About MATES :
MATES is a charity established to reduce the high level of suicide among New Zealand construction workers. MATES leverages industry participation and support to further embed suicide prevention and mental health awareness into our industry culture. The model delivers an integrated programme of community development and support, utilising training as a tool to raise awareness, reduce stigma and encourage help-seeking, help-offering and help-accepting behaviours.

title: LCCA Celebrates!
description: This podcast provides news and events to the families at Legacy Classical Christian Academy.

title: La Pizarra de Francisca
description: Un podcast donde hablaremos temas de educación, normalismo, la escuela y su cotidianidad. Un espacio de participación creado por nuestra institución para toda la comunidad educativa.

description: Por Jazmin, Estrella, Grisel y Frida

title: HABIT Talks: All Inclusive
description: "HABIT Talks: All Inclusive“ nimmt dich mit ins Herz unserer Organisation. Mit unserem Podcast möchten wir einen akustischen Raum schaffen, in welchem wir der Vielfalt bei HABIT eine Stimme verleihen. Gemeinsam mit unseren Kolleg*innen geben wir Einblicke in unsere vielseitige Arbeit in der Begleitung von Menschen mit Behinderungen. Dabei widmen wir uns auch unterschiedlichen Themen, die uns beschäftigen, wie Inklusion und Selbstbestimmung.

title: Guardianes del Bosque

Entrevistas cortas con el Comité en defensa del Bosque Nixticuil, en Jalisco.
Aprende lo que se está haciendo por conservar tu bosque!

title: Walking and Talking
description:
Walking and Talking is a four-part conversational Podcast series by The Line. Featuring artists, creatives and members of the local community who discuss themes and ideas related to The Line and the areas that it connects by visiting Greenwich Peninsula, the Royal Docks, Cody Dock and Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park.

Whether you’re on the route or somewhere else in the world, we hope you enjoy discovering more about The Line and its context.

title: Voices of Youth in Obesity
description: To date, there has been relatively limited research, discussion and policy focus on adolescent obesity, yet one in seven 15 years olds in Europe has overweight, or has obesity. Young adults with obesity are continuously stigmatised, and ‘blamed’ for their weight. A prime example of the weight bias and stigma is prevalent in the images used by the media. Currently teenagers with obesity are not receiving the support, guidance, treatment and care that has been indicated in ACTION Teens study 2022, Lund University study 2021, International project called ‘Confronting obesity: Co-creating policy with youth’ (COCREATE) 2021. This Campaign will a focus on the real lived experiences of teenagers across Europe who are living with, or affected by overweight or obesity. We have been engaging with young adults from Bulgaria, Germany, Spain, Portugal, the United Kingdom, and Ireland who have come together to discuss how THEY feel, and their experiences with obesity.

title: AAPC
description:
Asian American Perspectives and Connections Magazine - We are currently an online magazine working to spread awareness, perspective and connections throughout campus amongst Asian and non-Asian students. We routinely publish many stories and articles on a variety of topics such as art, entertainment, food, culture and history, and many more. Our mission is to give a voice to the diverse perspectives of Asian American students to help foster growth and inclusivity. 

Check us out at aapc-ud.com!

title: Project Give Back Connects
description:
Welcome to Project Give Back Connects,

This is an extension of Project Give Back in the classroom.

We are dedicated to inspiring young students to become more empathetic, understanding and community minded  leaders.

These episodes offer thoughts and inspiration from experts, accomplished youth leaders, musical guests and even calls to action from One2giveto.

Project Give back offers a dose of inspiration and thoughts for discussion

Each live episode is taped and shared  with classroom teachers and their students.

Let’s get connected…..

title: The Broken Banquet

The Broken Banquet is a podcast about missions hosted by Wil Bailey and Dr. Ashley Goad. Join us for conversations about the church in mission, what healthy mission relationships can look like and as we hear from others who have dedicated their lives in one way or another to mission work. 

Visit our website at https://www.brokenbanquetpodcast.com.

title: Behind The Red Shield
description: Behind the Red Shield is a podcast produced by The Salvation Army of Memphis & The Mid-South. The purpose of this podcast is to go behind the scenes and hear from the people doing the daily work to achieve The Salvation Army’s mission - which is to meet human needs in His name without discrimination.
author_name: The Salvation Army of Memphis & The Mid-South

description: Los miércoles, cada 15 días, la voluntaria de la asociación Gats de Carrer Cubelles, Marta López, presenta en Radio Cubelles el Programa GATS, un espacio donde hablamos de las últimas actuaciones de la asociación así como de temas relacionados con los michis con invitados como veterinarios, peluqueros felinos, miembros de la administración pública... title: Building Trusted Spaces Educator Series
description:
All It Takes invites you to join us for the Building Trusted Spaces Educator Series - a free resource for all Public School Educators and Personnel, brought to you in partnership with the CalHOPE Schools Initiative. 

Lori Woodley, CEO of All It Takes, will be joined by a panel of Educators once a month to discuss Social Emotional Learning and how to best implement it in our schools. Join us for tips, tricks, anecdotes, and laughter as we share stories of success and advice from a diverse group of Educators from across California. 

The Building Trusted Spaces Educator Series features education and mental health experts on the fourth Tuesday of each month as part of the CalHOPE Schools Initiative for Student and Educator Support and Wellness. The podcast is always free and we look forward to seeing you every month.

title: Pro Ciegos y Sordos de Guatemala

title: Living Vertizontal
description: Living Vertizontal is a weekly podcast from The Church at Riverstone, A Fellowship of the Church of the Nazarene in Madera, CA.  Living Vertizontal explores Scripture and celebrates the work of the Holy Spirit in our world.

title: THE SKATEROOM Podcast
Uit het veld: de podcast over ontwikkelingssamenwerking
description: Er is nogal wat te bespreken over ontwikkelingssamenwerking. Hoe bestrijden we bijvoorbeeld de grote crises van deze tijd op het gebied van gezondheid, klimaat, armoede en veiligheid? Daarom gaan de medewerkers van Cordaid en andere experts uit de ngo-sector en de politiek in verschillende samenstellingen met elkaar in gesprek om ideeën uit te wisselen, elkaar te bevragen of urgente zaken aan de kaak te stellen. Presentatie: Frank van Lierde

title: Natures True Crime
description:
Thanks for tuning in to listen to Nature’s True Crime, tales of the more unknown natural disasters, how they happened, and what impacts they had on the areas affected. 
Every now and then we do an "Off the rails" section, where we discuss weird, unknown, things that have happened that may not specifically fall under the "Nature" theme.

Natures True Crime is a podcast produced by Saneka's Legacy an environmental education non profit in Florida.
All in all we like to discuss odd occurrences and have fun!

title: Christown's Titus 2 Ministry- Teach Me to Love
description: Welcome to Christown Bible Study,  a ministry dedicated to mentoring women. In Titus 2:3-5 the Word of God, tells us that the older women are to teach the younger women. So, together we study the Word and learn to love and  respect our husbands, love our children and to be the guardian and protectors  of our home- all in very practical ways. Every episode will leave you feeling encouraged to love God, Love your husband and Love your children!

title: A4LI H-SPAN Podcast
description: Our Podcast highlights notable figures within the longevity field. The goal is to create social and political action around the issues of combating age-related chronic conditions and increasing our number of healthy, disease-free years!

title: Step One Halfway House Podcasts a Social Model in Recovery
description: Step One Halfway House is a recovery home for adult males with substance abuse problems, mental health issues and alcoholics that desire a new way of living. We serve the weakest among us; the helpless and homeless, the forgotten and those who fall through the cracks. Here at Step One, we are passionate about achieving our goal of helping the homeless population, veterans, and those who suffer from substance abuse disorder in Phoenix, AZ. As such, every donation of money, men’s clothing, men’s shoes, hygiene products, furniture, and appliances count towards aiding homeless individuals in their journey to getting back on their feet and living the life they lost.

title: JPG Morning Convocation
description: Morning Convocation at St. John Paul the Great is a brief, 5 minute address given to students at the beginning of every school day. The purpose of Daily Convocation is to provide our students with a multitude of witnesses communicating their relationship with Christ and the Church.

title: Hippo & Friends type 1 diabetesfonds podcast
description:
Welkom bij de Hippo & Friends podcast. 

In deze podcast behandelen we thema’s die belangrijk zijn voor mensen met type 1 diabetes. Type 1 diabetes is een chronische auto-immuunziekte die ongeveer 50 000 Belgen treft. Met het Hippo & Friends type 1 diabetesfonds creëren we meer bewustzijn, dragen we bij tot projecten voor meer levenskwaliteit en steunen we wetenschappelijk onderzoek.

title: Voices Of Wilderness
description: Voices of wilderness, produced by the WILD Foundation, dives into wilderness concepts and stories that will inspire and empower you to speak out, take action, make a difference and find solutions to the biodiversity and climate crisis.

description: La prima forma di welfare contrattato il Luxottica

title: Art of Courage Ukraine
description:
One of the largest tragedies of modern history is taking place in Ukraine right at this moment. Thankfully, technology is here to document the facts. 

The active participation of media continues to play a crucial role in the informational war against russian propaganda. It is our job to maintain the momentum by providing authentic stories with an international platform.

title: The Green Hour
description: A community of innovators, activists, and government leaders in the world of sustainability. Each week, Preston Poag interviews leaders of sustainability to discuss their successes, failures, and lessons learned in the pursuit of a greener world.

title: The Self-Love and Healing Podcast (2022)
description: 'The Self-Love and Healing Podcast' aims to shed light on the realities of sexual harassment and assault. It hopes to convey mantras that promote and support the recovery and psychosocial development of survivors. Moreover, gain a better understanding of TUGON’s advocacy as guests are interviewed about special topics relating to it!

description: Weekly teaching and interviews from Wellsprings Church, Casper, WY

title: Project N95 Presents
description: Project N95 is a national non-profit working to protect people and their communities during the COVID-19 pandemic and beyond. Through our shop, we provide equitable access to affordable, authentic N95 respirators, KN95 and KF94 masks, kids masks, COVID-19 tests, and other products. Through our advocacy, education, and distribution of vetted goods and services, we strive to keep everyone safe and informed.

title: The Giving Circle
description: Welcome to the giving circle.

title: Dermo Atopico - všetko o atopickej dermatitíde
description: NAŠOU MISIOU JE ŠÍRIŤ POVEDOMIE O ATOPICKEJ DERMATITÍDE, PODPOROVAŤ PACIENTOV, VZDELÁVAŤ KOMUNITU. VERÍME, ŽE KAŽDÝ PACIENT MÁ MAŤ PRÍSTUP K INFORMÁCIÁM, KTORÉ POMÔŽU VYLEPŠIŤ KVALITU ŽIVOTA.

title: Dive in with (e)me
description:
Fondation EME creates its new podcast to aware people on various subject linking music with social issues (people with specific needs, people isolated from society...). Every episode, discover a new guest who will discuss with Sarah Bergdoll topics relevant to its area of expertise. Dive in with (e)me... a podcast by Fondation EME. Music by Gast Waltzing and mixed by Taipan.

Podcast is made possible by the André Losch Fondation.

title: The Nuclear View
description: The Nuclear View is meant to give listeners inside access to the thoughts and ideas of the member-practitioners of NIDS including our Fellows, Analysts, and Interns. For each episode we pick a current deterrence topic and have a cordial, exciting and sometimes funny discussion. title: This Is Civity
description:
Civity is a culture of deliberately engaging in relationships of respect and empathy with others who are different.
Our world today is one of haves and have-nots, insiders and outsiders, people who belong and people who are marginalized because they are other.
By reaching out person-to-person to others who are different, all of us together create the relational infrastructure to build solidarity, justice, and resilience in our communities.
Our differences are our strengths. This is ‘civity.’
Our podcast showcases interviews with people bridging power-based divides to move communities forward on issues grounded in inequities.

title: Het rouwt in jou
description:
Welkom bij ‘Het rouwt in jou’, de podcast van vzw het Berrefonds die jou wil helpen, troosten, inspireren en steunen na het verlies van een kind*.

In eerlijke gesprekken komen alle aspecten van rouw en verdriet aan bod om jou zo inzichten en woorden te geven. Dankzij deze podcast ontdek je hopelijk dat alles wat je voelt normaal is en dat er ruimte moet zijn voor rouw en verdriet en dat je tijd mag vragen en nemen. Zelfs een leven lang.

Deze podcast is er voor ouders, maar ook voor de ruime framily en professionals of zorgverleners rond een overleden kind. Dit immense verdriet bespreekbaar maken, kunnen we vanuit het Berrefonds niet alleen, daar hebben we hulp voor nodig. Want iedereen kent wel iemand die een kind verloor.

Dus wie je ook bent en op welke manier je ook geconfronteerd wordt met dit verdriet, we zijn blij dat je luistert en we hopen dat we met deze podcast mee het verschil kunnen maken.

Deze podcast kwam tot stand met de warme steun van een heel aantal mooie mensen. Mira Bertels & Wannes Deneer, ouders van Sam*, componeerden de zachte muziek. Seppe, de nonkel van George* zorgde voor de opname en montage van bijna alle afleveringen. Gunther, de papa van Finn* & Lenne* verzorgde de opname van de aflevering in onze Koestercaravan. Uiteraard ook een warm dankjewel aan iedereen die kwam praten aan onze tafel.
We dragen dit alles op aan al de kinderen* die we missen en ons nog elke dag inspireren en moed geven om verder te gaan.  

Heb je na het beluisteren van deze aflevering nood aan een babbel of wil je meer weten over de volledige dienstverlening van het Berrefonds? Surf dan even naar berrefonds.be en ontdek wat we nog allemaal voor jou kunnen doen. Of wat jij voor ons kunt doen.

Want het Berrefonds is voor haar werking bijna volledig afhankelijk van giften. Als je het waardevol vindt wat wij doen voor gezinnen met verdriet, help ons dan met een gift zodat we ook kunnen blijven zorgen voor de ouders van morgen.

We vinden het zo erg dat het rouwt in jou.

title: Where are the children?
description:
Contact: If you would like to be a guest on our podcast, or volunteer or donate, please visit our website: wwww.silentvictimsofcrime.org or call us 305-482-3339.

About the podcast.

“Where are the children?” podcast by Silent Victims of Crime non-profit explores the urgent and important societal question, what happens to the children when a parent is incarcerated? Current statistics states that there are 2,7 million children experiencing parental incarceration right now and 70 % of children of prisoners may end up in the prison system.

Every month we will be bringing in experts in prison reform, child development, trauma, healing and education

Meet the hosts of the podcast:

Tinkerbell Paulette Pfeiffer, Second Generation Holocaust Survivor and Founder of Silent Victims of Crime and We Stand for Kids. She has worked with children of incarcerated parents for 27 years. @silentvictimsofcrime

Weslye Saunders, NFL Veteran, Wellness Coach, Community Activist and founder of Wes Joose & Win With Wes. @wes_saunders88

Midia Joy, Transformational & Healing Arts Coach, Artist and founder of My Joy Academy. @midia_joy_coaching

Together we are going to be bringing awareness to the silent victims of current societal structures and providing insight into what we know have worked for our organization.

About Silent Victims of Crime and the five circles of support.

Silent Victims of Crime has served over 1,000 children in 27 years and we do everything we can to ensure that no child in our program goes to prison through providing a strong support system with the five circles of support:

  1. Youth empowerment programs.

  2. Parent programs.

  3. Caregiver support.

  4. Community collaboration.

  5. Mentoring & peer support.

Our Vision:

Our programs have yielded great success in our families’ lives and we want to be able to expand it nationwide as our vision is to break the intergenerational cycle of incarceration.

Thank you dear listener!

Thank you for all your support in creating awareness around this important and urgent societal question, “Where are the children?”.

Contact:

If you would like to be a guest on our podcast, or volunteer or donate, please visit our website: wwww.silentvictimsofcrime.org or call us 305-482-3339.

More information on Silent Victims of Crime:

Silent Victims of Crime (SVC) is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization that works to empower children of incarcerated parents in South Carolina and Florida by providing educational enrichment, social support, and positive mentoring.

Our Mission is to Assist children of inmates by enhancing their ability to improve their economic, educational and personal stability while addressing behavioral, social and mental issues. We help these at-risk children to deal with life challenges in a positive, proactive manner that empowers them to make wise choices and contribute positively to society.

Music

Podcast intro and outro by Lundstroem 🎶.

https://takenode.org/certificate?id=2dd825c1-5594-42d2-a937-178fea3413d

title: I'm not ok....and that's ok

In this first episode we will be discussing receiving your child's diagnosis, in this case, the diagnosis is level two Autism. We will talk about about what it took to get to this point, the missed milestones, the diagnosis, and life after the diagnosis. We will discuss what the diagnosis meant for the child, as well as the family. Being a parent/caregiver is hard, and there are a variety of emotions involved, listen as we tackle this maze and understand that it's ok not to not feel ok somedays.

Цялата отговорност за съдържанието на документа се носи от Българския център за нестопанско право и Асоциацията на европейските журналисти – България и при никакви обстоятелства не може да се приема, че този документ отразява официалното становище на Финансовия механизъм на Европейското икономическо пространство и Оператора на Фонд Активни граждани България.

title: Milken Community School Podcast
description:
Welcome to the Milken Community School podcast, where we dive into the rich history and vibrant culture of this exceptional institution. As one of the premier independent schools in the Los Angeles area, Milken Community School is home to a diverse and dynamic community of students, teachers, and stakeholders who are passionate about education, innovation, and making a positive impact on the world.

In this podcast, we will bring you conversations with members of our community, exploring their unique perspectives and experiences. From current students and faculty to alumni and community partners, we will delve into the stories and insights that make Milken Community School such a special place.

With a history spanning over 30 years, Milken Community School has evolved into a nationally recognized leader in education, providing an exceptional academic program that prepares students for success in college and beyond. Through our podcast, we aim to highlight the incredible achievements of our community members, while also providing an inside look at the day-to-day life on our campus.

So join us as we explore the rich tapestry of Milken Community School, and get to know the people who make this institution such a vibrant and inspiring place to learn and grow.

title: Alopecia's Audacity Podcast
description: Alopecia's Audacity is a podcast that focuses on the topic of Alopecia Areata, an autoimmune disease characterized by the loss of hair on the scalp and other parts of the body. The podcast is hosted by the Canadian Alopecia Areata Foundation (CANAAF), a nonprofit that aims to raise awareness and provide support to individuals who are affected by alopecia by sharing stories, experiences, and information from experts in the field. With its bold and daring approach, the podcast encourages listeners to embrace their unique journey with alopecia and to be proud of who they are. Join co-hosts and alopecia advocates, Christal Malcolm, Lauryn Harrison, and Sara Teskey as they delve into the complexities of living with hair loss and explore what it means to defy the audacity of alopecia.

title: Breaking Barriers: The AsianVisiON Podcast
description:
Mainstream Western media and education have largely dismissed the successes and challenges of the Asian community, often portraying Asian individuals as “obedient” and “naturally intelligent” (amongst other stereotypes). These characteristics that reflect the model minority stereotype often pressure Asian individuals to meet these cultural expectations. Breaking Barriers by AsianVisiON strives to break down the barriers these expectations have built and foster a supportive environment for Asian individuals by raising awareness about the challenges that people of the majority may not need to face. In each episode, you will hear the unique stories of Asian leaders in various industries. From challenges and successes to the ways their Asian identity impacted their paths, to their vision for the future, our guests offer valuable insights for aspiring Asian leaders and allies.

AsianVisiON is a nonprofit organization that seeks to break cultural barriers and create intercultural connections for the Asian community in Canada by spreading awareness and sharing first-hand experiences.

Follow us on Instagram @asianvisi.on for Asian related content and more!

title: Assicurazione RCA temporanea - Occhio ai siti FASULLI
description: Da qualche anno in rete girano centinaia di siti irregolari/falsi che sponsorizzano assicurazioni RCA online fasulle, gli intermediari sono agenti abusivi non autorizzati da IVASS, ovviamente le polizze RCA temporanee vendute da questi soggetti sono false e le conseguenze per gli utenti che incappano nella frode sono catastrofici. Oggi diverse community collaborano tra loro per segnalare in rete le compagnie assicurative false che spesso si spacciano e rubano i dati aziendali di compagnie di assicurazioni note, purtroppo le Autorità di controllo non riescono ad essere tempestivi per stroncare sul nascere tale fenomeno, i siti fasulli vengono pubblicati incessantemente in rete da bande criminali ben organizzate motivo per cui è difficile bloccarli nell'immediato, le segnalazioni in rete sicuramente accorciano la vita a questi siti falsi e possono mettere al riparo coloro che fanno ricerca in rete.

title: Burned Ambition by Burned Beauty 2018 - A Burn Survivors Podcast
description:
Burned Ambition is a State of Mind. It’s the term our host, Tonya Meisenbach, uses to describe the calling she has to help others and to create platforms that help others others to help themselves. She’s created these things since being severely burned four years ago and she, therefore, calls it her Burned Ambition.

Her guests and topics are designed to help the burn community handle their injuries and accept themselves as they are. Tonya also shares never before heard parts of her own story. She wants you to know that you are enough.

She works daily to inspire OTHERS as @BurnedBeauty2018 on Instagram, Facebook, YouTube & TikTok.

Tonya diligently works to grow her nonprofit for burn survivors, The Burned Beauty Foundation, Inc. She hopes to actively offer growth coaching, financial support, medical copays, therapy, etc. to her community at no charge.

The main purpose of this podcast is to gain sponsors and donations to achieve her goals for her nonprofit. To date she has fully self-funded this broadcast - as this is a labor of love.

Please remember to SUBSCRIBE, COMMENT, LIKE & SHARE, so that survivors in need know where to go to find solace.

title: Let's Share!
description:
The mission of Have A Need A Ministry (HANA), a 501 (c) 3 faith-based nonprofit, is to promote and support local community members sharing and receiving. The Let's Share podcasts model sharing of friendship, evidence of God's work in our lives, and the passions and organizations the guests have for sharing. The discussions of the sharing include perspectives among individuals and organizations, especially but not exclusively nonprofits with a Christian worldview. Guests on the podcast discuss their connection with the host and their passion to serve. HANA Ministry encourages free events and programs, information, items, and employment shared in communities on social media platforms including Facebook, Instagram, and LinkedIn. HANA's core values are based on scripture including Acts 4:32 - "All the believers were united in heart and mind. And they felt that what they owned was not their own, so they shared everything they had."

Podcast host and HANA President and Founder Dr. Leigh Byers has served in church ministry and faith-based nonprofit leadership positions since 2003 and is also currently an adjunct professor for a Christian university and a business consultant. Her passion is to support individuals and organizations to serve each other well.
author_name: Leigh Byers, Founder and President of Have A Need A Ministry
